metadata.title: novacrate
metadata.description: Web-based interactive editor for creating, editing and visualising research object crates.
metadata.notes: If you use this software, please cite it using these metadata.

metadata.title: bodkan/slendr: slendr 1.2.0
metadata.description:
• Due to new issues related to conda activating environments in an incorrect path which started to pop up (possibly due to a misfeature in the reticulate package), activating procedure in slendr was reverted to a slower, but apparently more robust approach. This will unfortunately make running massively parallelized simulations on Windows problematic due to a suspected-but-hard-to-detect race condition in conda on Windows, which manifested in many parallel environment activations (one for each simulation process) on this platform. For the time being, users are advised to execute big parallelized simulations (we're talking thousands of simulations in an ABC setting) on unix systems. (PR #182)

  • slendr now allows recording of specific singular samples under unique names. See the documentation to schedule_sampling() for an example. (PR #181)

  • The dependency rnaturalearth has introduced some low-level changes that required minor tweaks to slendr's spatial internals. Thanks to @PMassicotte for his kind help on fixing this! (PR #180)

  • Fixed an issue with setting lock = TRUE in the set_range() function (issue #176 reported by @Sgornard -- thank you!). (#6d01e407)

  • If a non-spatial population is created which has a spatial parent population, slendr gives an informative error message. (#6bb646)

  • plot_model() now uses the same color for population ranges and population labels. (#c54632e5)

  • plot_map() can now optionally visualize splits in a spatial setting (#4664388c)

  • plot_model() now plots y-axis time using a more readable integer scale. (#6b0e7fcc)

metadata.title: Research Software Directory (as a service)
metadata.description: The Research Software Directory (as a service) is a content management system that is tailored to research software. Its main goal is to increase the visibility, impact and reuse of research software.

data.title: Two new Pristimantis (Anura: Strabomantidae) of the P. lacrimosus species group from the eastern Guiana Shield lowlands

metadata.title: Open and Reproducible Science in R Technical Handbook
metadata.description:
This is the third release of the Oxford IHTM Handbook. In this release:

What's Changed

  • update README by @ernestguevarra in https://github.com/OxfordIHTM/ihtm-handbook/pull/78
  • add analytics id; spell check; fix #80; fix #82 by @ernestguevarra in https://github.com/OxfordIHTM/ihtm-handbook/pull/83

  • add netlify test deploy; fix #91 by @ernestguevarra in https://github.com/OxfordIHTM/ihtm-handbook/pull/93
  • add CITATION.cff; fix #92 by @ernestguevarra in https://github.com/OxfordIHTM/ihtm-handbook/pull/96

data.title: Open and Reproducible Science in R Technical Handbook

metadata.title: DATA SECURITY IN CLOUD COMPUTING
metadata.description:
This paper addresses data protection in the cloud. It is a cloud review of data and security-related aspects. The paper will cover the strategies and techniques for data security used worldwide to ensure optimum data safety by reducing danger and hazard.
Data available in the cloud is advantageous for certain applications, but it raises challenges as data is exposed to applications that already have safety breakdowns. Similar to that, the use of cloud storage for virtualization could place data at risk as a guest
operating system runs over a hypervisor without understanding whether the guest operating system will be protected. It also offers an insight into Data-In-Transit and Data-at-Rest security aspects. The analysis focuses on all levels of SaaS (service software), PaaS (service platform) and IaaS (service infrastructure).

metadata.title: CLOUD BASED MOBILE FORENSIC TOOLS CONCEPTS AND USES
metadata.description: To solve the problem of adapting to the structure of mobile forensic tools, this paper presents a mobile cloud-based forensic tool. In terms of lower cost for better resource distribution and management, mobile cloud technology will greatly benefit from the cloud model. The device architecture is designed to reduce the cost of mobile forensic software by extracting offensive content from smartphones with a cloud service model. Data stored on your smartphone during a survey can be very useful for your survey. Mobile devices now display key personal information through simple call history, addresses and text messages. Mobile information such as emails, web history and chat logs are also stored on the smartphone. Mobile devices are expected to provide more powerful information that can connect with humans in all changes than most machines, making it harder to access this information from legally accurate cloud storage. This framework allows you to quickly access mobile forensic tools in the cloud and leverage the resources of healthcare professionals. Therefore, the development of mobile forensic tools in the cloud plays an important role.

metadata.title: CloudnetPy: A Python package for processing cloud remote sensing data
metadata.description: CloudnetPy is Python software designed for producing vertical profiles of cloud properties from ground-based remote sensing measurements.
metadata.notes: If you use this software, please cite our article in the Journal of Open Source Software.

metadata.description:
Version 2.0.0 - Major Licensing Update

🚨 Important Licensing Change

This release introduces a dual licensing model for this project:

  • Non-commercial use: MIT License (free for academic, personal, and research use)
  • Commercial use: Requires separate license - contact asifpatankar@rocketmail.com for licensing terms

What's Changed

  • Updated licensing model to protect commercial use while maintaining open-source availability
  • Added comprehensive LICENSE file with dual licensing terms
  • Updated README with clear licensing guidelines

For Commercial Users

If you plan to use this software for:

  • Commercial products or services
  • Revenue-generating activities
  • Business/enterprise applications

Please contact: asifpatankar@rocketmail.com for commercial licensing options.

Files Updated

  • LICENSE (dual licensing terms)
  • README.md (licensing section added)

Note: All previous versions remain under MIT License. This licensing change applies to v2.0.0 and future releases.
